page.title: 20MEADS OF ST.JOHN West Forres
page.content: This flat area of light sandy soil about 40 hectares in extent,a river terrace on the banks of the River Findhorn,is now used for farming.In the Middle Ages when Darnaway Castle belonged to the Crown and Royal parties visited,jousting and tournaments were held in this pleasant natural amphitheatre.In 1563 Mary Queen of Scots visited Darnaway and a tournament to celebrate her visit was held.An old manuscript relates that a canopy was erected amongst the oaks for the ladies.There are still massive oaks at the river's edge but it is doubtful that they would be those mentioned in 1563.It is known that the oaks must have been fairly large in 1829 when they withstood the exceptional flooding of the Findhorn River.
